snippet: After viewing areas on Staten Island and in Queens affected by Hurricane Sandy, President Obama said he was assigning his housing secretary, Shaun Donovan, to oversee the recovery.
abstract: Pres Obama visits New York City areas affected by Hurricane Sandy, promising a strong and continuing federal role in the recovery efforts.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Danny Hakim, Raymond Hernandez, Christopher Maag and Vivian Yee.

lead_paragraph: After viewing areas on Staten Island and in Queens affected by Hurricane Sandy, President Obama said he was assigning his housing secretary, Shaun Donovan, to oversee the recovery.

headline.seo: Obama Views Hurricane Sandy Recovery in New York
headline.main: Obama, Visiting New York, Pledges Help in Recovery From Storm
headline.print_headline: Obama, Visiting New York, Pledges Help in Recovery From Storm
